tool.name: PhyML
tool.description: Estimates maximum likelihood phylogenies from alignments of nucleotide or amino-acid sequences

exit_code.description: The tool's exit code was 1, which suggests that something went wrong.

tool.command:
filename=./`basename $seq_file_name` &&
cp $seq_file_name \$filename &&
phyml -i \$filename
#if $data_sets_selector.data_sets == "1" -n "$data_sets_selector.data_sets" #if $data_sets_selector.bootstrap_selector.bootstrap == "1" -b "$data_sets_selector.bootstrap_selector.num_bootstrap" #else -b "$data_sets_selector.bootstrap_selector.bootstrap" #end if #else -n "$data_sets_selector.nb_data_sets" -b "$data_sets_selector.bootstrap" #end if
-c "$nb_subst_cat"
-d "$sequences.data_type" #if $sequences.data_type == "nt" -m "$sequences.selection.model_name" #if $sequences.selection.model_name == "HKY85" or $sequences.selection.model_name == "K80" or $sequences.selection.model_name == "F84" #if $sequences.selection.ratio.ts_tv_ratio == "e" -t "$sequences.selection.ratio.ts_tv_ratio" #else -t "$sequences.selection.ratio.fixed" #end if #end if -f "$sequences.eq_freq" #end if #if $sequences.data_type == "aa" -m "$sequences.model_name" -f "$sequences.eq_freq" #end if
#if $prop_invar_selector.prop_invar == "f" -v "$prop_invar_selector.prop_invar_fixed" #else -v "$prop_invar_selector.prop_invar" #end if
#if $gamma_selector.gamma == "f" -a "$gamma_selector.gamma_fixed" #else -a "$gamma_selector.gamma" #end if
-o "$optimise_selector.optimise" #if $optimise_selector.optimise == "tlr" or $optimise_selector.optimise == "tl" -s "$optimise_selector.move" #end if
#if $seq_file_selector.seq_file == "s" -q #end if
#if $tree_searching.user_tree_file == "upload" -u "$tree_searching.tree_file_name" #end if

param.name: eq_freq
param.label: Equilibrium Frequencies
param.option: Estimated using the frequencies defined by the Substitution Model

param.name: bootstrap
param.label: Bootstrap
param.help: Compute aLRT (Statistical Test to Compute Branch Supports) (-b, --boostrap)

param.name: bootstrap
param.label: Bootstrap
param.help: Perform Bootstrap or Compute aLRT (Statistical Test to Compute Branch Supports) (-b, --boostrap)
param.option: Neither Approximate Likelihood Test Nor Bootstrap

param.name: gamma
param.label: Gamma Shape Parameter
param.help: Determines Range of Rate Variation Across Sites (-a, --alpha)

param.name: gamma_fixed
param.label: Gamma Shape Parameter Fixed by User

param.name: user_tree_file
param.label: Starting Tree(s)
param.help: Starting Tree to be Refined by the ML Algorithm (-u, --inputtree)

param.name: optimise
param.label: Optimise Starting Tree(s) options
param.option: Tree topology, Branch Lengths, Rate Parameters

tool.help:
**Description**
Galaxy tool wrapper for the PhyML program, which estimates the maximum likelihood phylogenies from alignments of nucleotide or amino acid sequences. For more information regarding the settings of the tool, please visit the PhyML Manual on http://www.atgc-montpellier.fr/download/papers/phyml_manual_2012.pdf
-----
**Inputs and Outputs**
- Inputs: + Accepts alignments of DNA or protein sequences in PHYLIP sequential or interleaved format + Accepts one or several phylogenetic trees from an input file
- Outputs: + Tree File in Newick format ((sequence file name)_phyml_tree.txt) + Model Parameter File ((sequence file name)_phyml_stats.txt) + If bootstrap support were evaluated - The Maximum Likelihood Trees ((sequence file name)_phyml_boot_tree.txt) + If bootstrap support were evaluated: The Substitution Model parameters estimated from each bootstrap replicate ((sequence file name)_boot_phyml_stats.txt)
-----
**Tool Information**
- PhyML Tool v3.1: + Release Date: March 2013 + Source URL: http://www.atgc-montpellier.fr/download/binaries/phyml/PhyML-3.1.zip
-----
**Author**
- PhyML: + Stephane Guindon, Olivier Gascuel, Wim Hordjik, Maria Anisimova, Franck Lethiec, Jean-Francois Dufayard, Vincent Lefort, Patrice Duroux + ATGC: PhyML - ATGC: Monpellier Bioinformatics platform + URL: http://www.atgc-montpellier.fr/phyml/
- PhyML Galaxy Wrapper: + Cime Ajouz + cime.ajouz@agr.gc.ca + Agriculture and Agri-foods Canada, Ottawa, ON, Canada
-----
**Citation**
"New Algorithms and Methods to Estimate Maximum-Likelihood Phylogenies: Assessing the Performance of PhyML 3.0." Guidon S., Dufayard J.F., Lefort V., Anisimova M., Hordijk W., Gascuel O. Systematic Biology, 59(3):307-21, 2010.
